intro: Verticordia helmsii, commonly known as the red-stemmed devil's bit, is a striking plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences that resemble small, red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
